column4: hmm, i can't help but feel that, having close to a terabyte of ntfs formatted volumes, bill gates has made me his bitch
since ntfs isn't too linux friendly, how windows friendly are linux filesystems?
any idea of the efficiency of ntfs vs ext2/3 in a windows environment?

It's not a matter of open filesystems being Windows-friendly, it's a matter of Microsoft adding support for them into Windows at no charge.  By default, you'll find that filsystems such as ext3 and ReiserFS will not work under Windows, but you can get them recognized with third-party drivers.
